creator: shuta.hanura

content:
Is it a POP account?

If it is, something may be happening that I am not familiar with. Maybe someone else can help.

You might check the account settings - Synchronization & Storage. I would enable "Keep messages in all folder for this account on this computer" and "Sychronize all messages locally regardless of age".

You might also right-click on the inbox in the folder pane, select "Properties", look in the "Syncronization" tab, and check that the folder is selected for offline use.

Were any of those settings off? Does turning them on solve the problem?
creator: mozilla98

content:
It's a POP account.

I have an update:

I found that deleting the emails stored on the mail server allowed new emails to be received in Thunderbird again.

I had set the mail server to keep emails for 14 days, in case emails weren't being delivered. It's possible that this caused the mail server to become full, preventing Thunderbird from receiving new emails.

I apologize for the complexity of the issue, but even before this incident, we were experiencing occasional problems with automatic reply emails not being delivered. I initially thought this current issue was an exacerbation of that problem, but it seems it was simply due to an overflow of emails on the mail server.

We are still investigating the "occasional automatic reply email delivery failures."

During those times, emails also failed to appear in the spam folder.
creator: shuta.hanura

content:
I have a BT email address, I also created some additional email addresses so members of family could use them.

I run two different versions of Thunderbird, the current ESR and also a BETA version. On ESR I have BT set up two of those email addresses as a Pop accounts and on Beta, one is set up as an Imap account.

Please confirm - is BT your Internet Service Provider? Is this an account because BT are ISP? OR is this a Business account etc ?

The email address and password used to access your main BT Account (where you see package details etc - not emails) must be the same email address and password as used for the main BT email address. Please confirm this is set up OK. All other alias email addresses etc can use their own separate password.

BT server settings have not changed. There is no special setup for Pop and Imap - both are auto enabled.

Q: Are you able to logon to BT webmail account via a browser? Q: Are you able to do this for all of your BT email addresses ?

Please confirm you can get webmail access to all 3 of your BT email addresses.

Q: Have you set up to use 2FA or not? It might be relevant or not, but it's not required to access via pop or imap.

Then post the following information:

  • In Thunderbird
  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts'
  • Copy all the data in that section and paste it into this forum question OR upload an image showing all data in that section.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Servers from self-hosted accounts tend to be more restrictive than others, at least from my personal experience. Here is my suggestion:

  1. - click file>offline>download for the first account. This is to ensure that you have 100% of the headers and content downloaded.
  2. - now, COPY the inbox to Local folders, either by exiting thunderbird and copying with windows file explorer or by using the importexporttools addon (highlight Local Folders, rightclick and select the import mbox option and then locate and select the other account's inbox file. This copies the messages to your local folders.
  3. - now, create a manually-run filter to upload to the other account.

My intent in this suggestion is to minimize activity that may be overloading the hostinger server.
creator: davidsk

content:
bdstanley said
Why does using the delete key on a highlighted message only create a strike through not an actual delete

Because you account setting are to mark deleted mail as such, not move it to a trash or deleted fold or delete it as such. Marked messages usually disappear after Thunderbird restarts and the expunge command it issued to the server for marked messages at shutdown (also in your account settings).

content: Ho configurato due account di posta elettronica, entrambi GMail. Spesso ho bisogno di trasferire la posta elettronica da un account all'altro all'interno del client. Il trasferimento dei messaggi da un account all'altro avviene senza problemi quando non hanno allegati o quando l'allegato è di dimensioni inferiori a 5MB Quando il messaggio che sposto contiene allegati di peso superiore a 5 MB, Thunderbird si blocca e il trasferimento non avviene. Google non blocca il trasferimento né ci sono problemi con le quote (sono amministratore di Google Wokspace). L'assistenza di Google mi conferma che non ci sono blocchi e che l'operazione dovrebbe andare a buon fine. Mi suggeriscono di contattare l'assistenza di Thunderbird. Esiste una procedura o un'impostazione del programma che permetta di trasferire senza problemi i messaggi da un account all'altro anche quando contengono allegati? Grazie

content:
Unfortunately, changing the settings to port 119 and no security has made no difference at all. I don't even get a newgroup list when I try to "Manage subscriptions".

Could I have broken something when I deleted the Thunderbird newsgroup? I realized a moment it was too late that I had right-clicked on the newsgroup and then chosen "Delete" rather than "Unsubscribe" so I wonder if that deleted some critical part of the underlying file structure and *that* is why I no longer get even newsgroup lists?

The good news is that I was able to subscribe to Newsgrouper, a free web interface to Usenet and it seems to work okay. I've used it to post to my newsgroup and asked if anyone else was having trouble with Eternal September. No replies yet....

In case anyone else sees this, all you have to do to use this service is go to newsgrouper.org, click on the Register button, then click on their email address (newsgrouper@yahoo.com) and write a short email asking them to register you for the service. Within a couple of hours, they send you a password. Then just go to newsgrouper.org again, fill in the email address you used to register and the password they gave you and click on "Login". That takes you to a page that lets you search for the newsgroup you want; once you've clicked on the newsgroup, you can read and post to the newsgroup.

content: Under server settings for the account, you must tick the box to always require authentication
creator: davidsk

content:
I've done that but it made no difference. I'm still getting only the Eternal September newsgroups.

[Pause] I've closed and reopened Tbird. Still only getting the Eternal September groups.

[Pause] I've deleted the newsgroup account and added it again, this time with the "Always require authentication" ticked from the start. FINALLY! *Now* I get Eternal September groups and I'm reconnected to the newsgroup where I hang out.

I'm disappointed that I had to have the "Always require authentication" selected from the creation of the account for things to work. That should NOT have been necessary! I should have been able to toggle that on or off at any time and have it take immediate effect WITHOUT removing and re-adding the account.

But all's well that ends well so thanks to everyone who helped me get past this problem!
creator: frank-lee-speeking

content: Thanks Dave. I have spent so long in trying to set up and work this with Filelink that I have given up. It seems so complicated. I wish there was a simple guide - 1. Do this; 2. Do that, etc.
creator: colin.jannaway

content:
(a) It is not mandatory to use Filelink. You can still attach files in the ordinary, old way.

(b) However, if you really want to use Filelink:

I think the link provided by david is easy to understand.

I think the difficult part is to decide which add-on to install: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/tag/filelink I use add-on "FileLink provider for Send": https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/filelink-provider-for-send/

Then you have to decide which Send service instance you want to use: https://github.com/timvisee/send-instances/ I use the following service instance: https://send.vis.ee

The following steps are based on the above-mentioned add-on and service instance:

1. "Settings" > "Composition" > "Attachments" > "Find more providers...". 2. Install add-on "FileLink provider for Send". 3. Back to "Attachments" > click "Add Thunderbird Send". 4. Enter the following data: 4.1. Send service instance URL: https://send.vis.ee > click "Verify". 4.2. Default download limit: 10 4.3. Default time limit: 3 days 4.4. Maximum file size: 2.5 GiB (Please see the attached image.)

When you attach a file to a message, Thunderbird might suggest using Filelink. 1. If you prefer to attach the file as a regular attachment, choose "Ignore". 2. If you prefer to use Filelink, click "Link" to upload the file to the online storage service provider.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: At a high level, my inference is that you want to switch from POP to IMAP. Assuming that to be true, you need to create a new account setup for the same account but in IMAP. Do not attempt to just change the POP to IMAP as that just makes huge errors. Then, if the other computers are also set for IMAP, they will all be able to access the messages.

content:
Using a gmail account where the same email is stored in multiple folders can cause this. IE import and inbox and all mail will all receive a copy due to the odd way google implement IMAP so it you have these folders subscribed, you will potentially get three new emails and three notifications.

I disabled the important folder at gmail and do not subscribe the all mail folder. I do not need two or more copies of everything.

content:
rjburke1 said

Matt said
just me guess https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird#

It's like we're using different Thunderbirds. None of these suggestions bears any resemblance to the Thnderbird (v128) that I'm looking at. For example: where is the message threading widget you're seeing? It would be useful to start with if I could see ALL my mails, but I can see only "Read" or "Unread". There's more emails in the stack, but I can only find them by going directly to webmail. It's the same for "Mail in Address Book": there's a third, non-visible, stack of mail, but I can't see it with Thunderbird.

Perhaps stop before you type the next message. Stop and remove you setting in the quick fo9lter bar that are preventing you from seeing you read message and those without attachments. (click on them)

This image you posted shows only messages that has an attachment and is also unread. You have pre-filtered the list to only those emails and you have none to display that meet that stipulation. So nothing is shown

This image which you posted with the first shows the full search of all folders with all messages included and of course you get to see your read messages in this search as the only criteria passed to the global search in the email address.

As matter of fact I see only one issue with this image, the quick filter bar shows the setting of attachments and unread, but fails to respect them for which I have filed a bug report https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1957851
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
This is likely just a "duh!" moment for me. The buttons in the "quick filter bar" escaped my attention until they were pointed out. They are the sort of thing I virtually never use, so I don't look for them.

Thanks for your patience.
creator: tzeller

content:
7rzf5yg7dd said
Two days ago I sent a message and have yet to receive an answer to why I can't use Mozilla Thunderbird to send or receive. I have been using this service for a number of years without any trouble and have questioned Telstra and they have said that the problem is related to Thunderbird. It would be nice to talk to somebody from your organization that can help. Sincerely Graeme Piera

Everyone finds it extremely difficult to try and support folk that simply do not include any diagnostic information in their request. I have issued such a request for your original topic. You have posted twice and even now it is still not clear what your issue is. My personal interactions with Telstra support have made it clear I would get better advice behind the school toilets among the kids smoking. They issue blame where there is none and rarely blame the more likely problem software like Antivirus, VPN and Firewall or helpful products for corrupting settings like CCleaner and other system optimization software.
creator: MattAuSupport
